headline: Arizona Republican Posted Anti-Semitic Photoshop Before Speaking at White Nationalist Event
author: Jackson Richman
sentences:
pic.twitter.com/opVZayv0F2
— Nick Martin (@nickmartin) March 1, 2022
The image is obviously suggesting that Jews control CPAC, echoing the anti-Semitic trope of Jewish control of politics and institutions.
Arizona State Sen. Wendy Rogers posted an anti-Semitic image to her Gab account before speaking at the America First Political Action Conference (AFPAC) put on by Nick Fuentes to compete with CPAC.
The photoshopped image Rogers shared ahead of her remarks has her behind a dead rhino with the word CPAC on it, with the “A” featuring a Star of David, a Jewish symbol.
In addition to Rogers, who is expected to be censured by the Arizona State Senate, Reps. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-GA) and Paul Gosar (R-AZ) appeared at AFPAC.
On Friday, prior to her speech at the racist AFPAC event, Arizona lawmaker Wendy Rogers posted this photoshopped image on her Gab and Telegram accounts.
The rhino in the image symbolizes RINO, or Republican in Name Only, a label for those Republicans viewed not genuinely Republican.
At AFPAC, there was praise for Adolf Hitler and Russian President Vladimir Putin amid Russia’s military invasion of Ukraine.
GOP leaders and rank-and-file lawmakers have blasted one of or both of them for appearing at the far-right event.
On Tuesday, the GOP-controlled Arizona senate voted to censure Rogers for her appearance at the event.
In between Rogers is AFPAC leader Fuentes, a white nationalist and anti-Semite, and one other person.
The dead rhino is branded with the letters CPAC, which includes a Jewish Star of David.
Rogers appeared at AFPAC on Friday, a far-right alternative to CPAC.
The two events were held simultaneously.
Have a tip we should know?
